Review: “I’ve let myself be caught in the bloody maw of banal necessity.” So is this the theme of Henry's "confession"?

Movie: Bah, Humduck!: A Looney Tunes Christmas

Review: I love Bogart and I love Kay Francis, so of course I had to watch this movie. Based on the reviews I’d read, I didn’t expect much, but I actually thought it was pretty entertaining.There are some good jokes at the expense of Bogart’s character, Joe Gurney, a crime boss who styles himself after Napoleon. When Dr. Carole Nelson (Francis) treats him and suggests he’s “the moronic type,” he doesn’t know what that means and thinks it’s just a…

Movie: To Be or Not to Be

Review: I hope the folks who planned and executed the stunts were well paid. (Paul Shapcott and Albert Sirvent are listed in the Letterboxd credits.) Terrific work. The choreography of the kitchen fight in the last episode was especially outstanding.

Movie: Night Stalker: The Hunt for a Serial Killer

Review: Humphrey Bogart is such a compelling presence on the screen that even an otherwise somewhat ordinary movie like this one is worth watching. Bogie's Duke Berne is not as memorable a character as his Duke Mantee in Petrified Forest, but Bogie does a nice job portraying this Duke too—a complex character caught between his own self-interest and doing the right thing.Duke Berne is an ex-con who is trying to go straight so he can avoid returning to prison. When…
The new hat made all the difference.

Movie: The Killing of a Sacred Deer
Shiny Happy People: Duggar Family Secrets

Review: I watched this with my doppelganger. He liked it better than I did. Or was it the other way around?

This polemical documentary argues that rapacious landlords, led by NYU, have been destroying Greenwich Village, abetted by politicians and the banks. It makes some good points, but its scattershot approach undermines its effectiveness.
“I’ll tell you something, Reardon. If there’s one thing in this world I hate, it’s a double-crossing dame.”

An excellent documentary about the movement against the Vietnam War that culminated in massive demonstrations in October and November 1969. Quite a flashback for me, especially seeing the footage of the march in Washington on November 15, 1969, in which I participated.

The upbeat promise of the exceptionally catchy theme song is belied by the sadness of the love quadrangle at the heart of the movie. Excellent performances all around: the needy, good-hearted "mother at heart" Georgy (Lynn Redgrave), the selfish, cold-hearted b*tch Meredith (Charlotte Rampling), the lovable but irresponsible rogue Jos Jones (Alan Bates), and the predatory but possibly sincere James Leamington (James Mason).Georgy's not wrong when she tells Jos, "It’s the absolute story of my life. No matter what…

This limited series focuses on the 51-day siege at the Branch Davidians' compound in Waco, Texas, in 1993. It's fairly even-handed in its presentation of the actions of the ATF and FBI on the one hand and the cult members led by David Koresh on the other. I would have liked more background information about the Branch Davidians, but I know that's available elsewhere.I don't think I'll ever understand, though, how people can be caught up in a cult…
